Legal_Issue: Jurisdiction of the Federal Court to declare facts about marital status for immigration purposes
Basis_of_Claim: Plaintiff sought declarations of never being married and having answered truthfully in immigration interview
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of jurisdiction to declare factual matters such as marital status
Application_Error: Seeking declaratory relief on factual issues outside court's jurisdiction
Legal_Standard: Abuse of process; no reasonable cause of action
Decision_Outcome: Claim dismissed with costs to the defendant
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the court has jurisdiction to make factual declarations on marital status
Outcome_of_Review: Appeal not applicable; motion to strike upheld
Cause_of_Refusal: Alleged marriage and untruthful answers during immigration interview
Credibility_Issues: Alleged untruthful answers in immigration interview
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Jurisdictional challenge via motion to strike
Jurisdictional_Focus: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration-related factual declarations
Procedural_Issue: Abuse of process; improper use of declaratory relief
